name: Roof, Terraces & Walkways Waterproofing
Details
Area barricaded off to allow no access with signs posted/ visible to include date of application, "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Attach relevant photos
WP details listed at architectural drawings for clarifications are followed.
All floor should be with proper falls towards the floor waste with a min. 1:100 slope.
Attach relevant photos
WPM must be applied around the linear drains (grated drains) before adding the leveling screed.
Attach relevant photos
Membrane system & methodology checked off against Aland standard waterproofing details & MSDS
Substrate clean, structurally sound & ready to receive membrane as per application guidelines of specified waterproofing system.
Ensure no high points or crevices are in the substrate
HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Polybit PVC primer to all PVC drains and pipes - Apply selected primer at a rate of 100ml/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Primer substrate with Polybit Hydrapoxy or PU primer - Apply selected primer at a rate of 150-200 gr/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Seal all joints, gaps, cracks and penetrations with Polybit HydraFlex polurethane sealant. - Apply selected sealant as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Apply 1st coat of Polybit Hydraguard PU on floors with a turnup up and over external hobs. - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.5kg/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Apply 2nd coat of Polybit Hydraguard PU on floors with a turnup up and over external hobs - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.5kg/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Dry day for second coat (if required).
Attach relevant photos
Apply PolyGuard protective UV top coat. - Apply selected top coat at a rate of 0.2-0.6 kg/m2 in one or two coats, depending on traffic conditions as per datasheet & application guidelines

the WPM must be terminated at the specified height outlined in the wind classification report Via saw cut reglet or other WPM termination method specified at AS 4654.2, or can be overlap by approved elastomeric weather-resist coating by min. 150mm.
Attach relevant photos
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instruction. - Review result against datatsheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Attatch photos for the drainage conduit.
Attach relevant photos
If required - Rectification of defective works for failure of flood test/thickness test & all works completed.
Attach relevant photos
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
Lift Pits Waterproofing (Balconies)
Details
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application, "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Attach relevant photos
Membrane system & methodology checked off against Aland standard waterproofing details & MSDS
Substrate clean, structurally sound & ready to receive membrane as per application guidelines of specified waterproofing system.
Ensure no high points or crevices are in the substrate
HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Dampen the surface to ensure the highest level of adhesion
Attach relevant photos
Apply 1st coat of Polybit Hydralastic Flex 2K on walls and floors - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.6kg/m2 for 1.0-2.0mm thickness as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Apply 2nd coat of Polybit Hydralastic Flex 2K on walls and floors - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.6kg/m2 for 1.0-2.0mm thickness as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Inspect for any remaining leaks and treat with HydraPlug - Apply selected sealant as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instruction. - Review result against datatsheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
If required - Rectification of defective works for failure of flood test/thickness test & all works completed.
Attach relevant photos
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
Balcony
Details
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application, "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Attach relevant photos
WP details listed at architectural drawings for clarifications are followed.
Membrane system & methodology checked off against Aland standard waterproofing details & MSDS
Substrate clean, structurally sound & ready to receive membrane as per application guidelines of specified waterproofing system.
Ensure no high points or crevices are in the substrate
HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Polybit PVC primer to all PVC drains and pipes - Apply selected primer at a rate of 100ml/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Prime substrate with Polybit Hydrapoxy or PU primer - Apply selected primer at a rate of 150-200 gr/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Seal all corners, joints, gaps, cracks and penetrations with Polybit HydraFlex polurethane sealant - Apply selected sealant as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Balustrade base i.e shoe base or angle base installed & grouted with structural grout (as required)
Joint between bttom of base & substrate to be no greater than 10mm with continuous bead of caulking
Overflow at the ends of balustrades in place
Approximate width of over floor to be 50mm
Height of overflow must be lower than the bttom of subsill
Angle to be installed between end of base & wall with top of angle to be at FFL
Apply 1st coat of Polybit Hydraguard PU on floors with a turnup of 100mm on walls - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.5kg/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
The WPM must be terminated at the specified height outlined in the wind classification report, also the WPM must be employ at the water stop angles for doors and wondow (if Applicable)
Attach relevant photos
Apply 2nd coat of Polybit Hydraguard PU on floors with a turnup of 100mm on walls - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.5kg/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
The WPM must be terminated at the specified height outlined in the wind classification report, also the WPM must be employ at the water stop angles for doors and wondow (if Applicable)
Attach relevant photos
Dry day for second coat (if required).
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instruction. - Review result against datatsheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Attatch photos for the drainage conduit.
Attach relevant photos
If required - Rectification of defective works for failure of flood test/thickness test & all works completed.
Attach relevant photos
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
Internal Wet Area (Bathrooms & Laundries) Waterproofing
Details
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application, "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Attach relevant photos
Membrane system & methodology checked off against Aland standard waterproofing details & MSDS
Substrate clean, structurally sound & ready to receive membrane as per application guidelines of specified waterproofing system.
Ensure no high points or crevices are in the substrate
HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Polybit PVC primer to all PVC drains and pipes - Apply selected primer at a rate of 100ml/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Ensure all floor wastes & pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
Shower Angles in correct position & level
Door Angle is in correct position & level
Door & Shower Angle are 3mm guage aluminium
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufactuer's recommendations
Primer substrate (walls and floors) with Polybit Hydrapoxy - Apply selected primer at a rate of 150-200 gr/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Apply angles to builders FFL as required.
Attach relevant photos
Seal all joints and penetrations with Polybit HydraFlex polurethane sealant. - Apply selected sealant as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Apply 1st coat of Polybit Hydraguard PU on floors with a turnup of 250mm on walls - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.5kg/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
All floor wastes membranes to be turned down into floor waste
Waterproof walls of shower section up to ceiling. Seal taps & the like. 2x coats required.
Min 150mm kicker has been waterproofed (do width of roller 230mm)
Min 1500mm past shower screen has been waterproofed.
Waterproof all shower & adjacent walls
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufactuer's recommendations
Attach relevant photos
Apply 2nd coat of Polybit Hydraguard PU on floors with a turnup of 250mm on walls - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.5kg/m2 as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Dry day for second coat (if required).
Attach relevant photos
Apply 2 coats of Polybit Hybrid 150 waterbased polyurethane membrane on walls as required. - Apply selected membrane at a rate of 1.0 litres/m2 per coat as per datasheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instruction. - Review result against datatsheet & application guidelines
Attach relevant photos
Conduct a flood test to internal wet area.
Attach relevant photos
If required - Rectification of defective works for failure of flood test/thickness test & all works completed.
Attach relevant photos
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
